intro: Ferula huber-morathii, commonly known as the Morath's ferula, is a perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes plants like carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its aromatic foliage and tall, slender flowering stems. The plant produces yellowish-green flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family, and its roots are often used in traditional medicine. Ferula huber-morathii is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, showing resilience to drought and extreme temperatures.
